translation: ripple; reflect light (often from water); spreading effect

bump; push (esp to cause a chain reaction)

tribe of people with deer like characteristics
viscous lake; lake with oddly sticky water due to pollutants from rifts and other sources; known for its unusual biodiversity
tribe of highly skilled traders known for their singing and musical abilities; related to the Caru (little bit more of a reindeer)
an underground revolution primarily marked by using tsevhu as a code; and an expansive growth of Tsavhe culture
A tribe of dragon riders who often work as mail riders between cities (most often speak Yat'al'/ Ilexsond)
minute pillar; ancient pillar located in the suon kiin whose segments rotate every minute; used as a caravan landmark
tribe of wisp like people; not much is known
bead elimination game using same board as a kyode board (from marble; match; and push)
sea of glass (also called sakhodbo or keshtyakhodbo (thousand mile crater))
Sungka (southeast Asian mancala; from marble board)
glass willow located at the center of the sea of glass; acts as a landmark and light house for the northern passage; one of the few remaining landmarks of hiustrith
planet Earth; Terra (from tea pot planet; can be analyzed as dig planet or crevice planet)
scroll season (counting food stock; end of autumn)
jewel cave; located in the tiitueru; one of the largest cave systems on Onope; known for its calcite crystals and the glowing reaction they have with imai
another name for the Nabian salt flats - lit thin rain water above salt (forms a natural mirror)
closely related tribe of the Tkalevk; theorized to have had a common; not so distant ancestor
Migration or Tsevhu Ripple Checkers; marble board game characterized by a fight for a limited amount of spots around the outer edge of the board (I made it up, but it's a working game and quite fun)
three sun towers -- a lighthouse; an observation tower; and  a calibration tower
hell; hades; inferno; perdition (lit burning regret)
housome aka Feng shui hustle (game about finding the best layout for a house)
old tongue; old tsevhu; spoken at a much earlier time; dying out around the time right before the Hatsavhe where it then is revived
orc; tribe of orc-like people (dark hair or white hair; greenish or black skin; quills) also called the Najik Horde
Shorthand; the quicker way of writing tsevhu (lit. smooth word)
Butterfly festival; celebrating migration of butterflies and remembrance of the dead
people of the Lesser Clockworks tribe
people of the Greater Clockworks tribe
compound of 'qat' and 'tyuk'; for names of tyuk; such as Sakyote Qatyuk (Personified war); honor suffix = -qatu
alternative shorthand writing system for Tsevhu that is more CJK in appearance (also called Rineshet and Rene; from building block smooth word or earth smooth word)
humans (literally pale tribe; based on that humans are often albino (much much moreso than on earth))
city name (derived from place of crumbling)
flood season (beginning of spring; especially after little Spring; but can be any flooding)
Shifting Paths (based off Labyrinth boardgame; from path; fortifications; move)
butterfly ship; constellation (also called Benohinue; belief that this is where butterflies take souls to sail the sea of stars - 'eunae)
brother mountains; located north of the suon kiin; south pass is the only major pass through them
tribe often associated with/called leviathans; theorized as the original speakers of Tsevhu

Tenth Winter's Dance - A celebration of Tsanua, the longer cold season that occurs every ten years on Onope, with ribbon dances around short coniferous trees, ornament tossing competitions, and hot soup and fried foods aplenty. Typically celebrated in the beginning of (whichever month short winter usually starts in.)
tribe of people with monkey like characteristics
land of koi; the country of origin for tsevhu and the tsavhe
The Hunger; The Starving One (often associated with wendigo)
a person of Hekatl tribe (person of the tribe of dragon riders; usually referring to those who are out on their coming of age journey)
celebration of life/beginnings (holiday; new years; sometimes called Haejenesa instead esp recently)
mouth of dusk (also potentially dusk cow; can refer to Rome)
per; for each (used in percents and fractions; from every in - also uses full phrase of "num (case)-every num yn")
way out there; out past; beyond
far; by far (comparative; but denoting a big difference between it and the next option)
at; during; in (used with time or events)
on; on top; on top of; upon
a great deal; much; a lot; many (else pa- / ba-)
from (specific location); by (as in written or made by)
by far (superlative; but denoting a big difference between it and any other option)
unto; until; up to; to the point of (used with extents of things like size; from tho and yn)

such; same (); aforesaid; mentioned previously or will be mentioned (such a ...; more often dy or tzo but can be used with either referent marker or with words like kaun) sometimes appears as jae- when with other words
every time; every instance; whenever (lit all pebble (used for counting))
everyone; everybody; all (lit all one) (pl & uses pl det)
all; all of; each one of; every one of (pl; from every all; can use just aj for every instead)
which; which one (not a relative clause marker)
another; one more; one additional (often just io)
enough; adequate; sufficient; acceptable (from valuable pebbles)
good enough; kenough; very well; plenty (from valuable good)
all kinds of; all manner of
anyone (use with a clause marker to mean whoever/whosoever; also nmov or nmovi)
some (more often use indef.plural prn (might have to find specific instances for this prn; and maybe rework prns that use nru*)
many; many people (used by itself; when followed by a noun use pas)
most (from a lot of people; can be used with other nouns)
how much; how many; how + adj (also pasar dialectally)
both; together; each other/one another(implies two-but doesn't have to be; tanel is more often the form used for each other in reciprocals; when together is used as an adverb: use tan(-))
when; what time (also adv yor(-); double-check phrase is not conditional when using)
sudden danger in a perceived safe space (lit. teeth of goose; shortened to ukyjopyon)
undulating; swaying (esp grass; trees; and waves)
tch; dang it (disappointment); ow (after getting hurt)

puff of air (exhaled; plosive/stop) often just phut
rushing or moving water; esp rivers or waterfalls
suck in air (inhaled; ingressive) often just miib
platonic beloved; loved one; someone you care about or who is close to you (not usually in the romantic sense tho; can talk about close friends; most often an address)
fleeting moment; phase; short lived; brief (lit. smoke moment; for verbs use the momentane aspect instead; compare with lyus)
the feeling of satisfaction from a really good meal; stuffed (lit. strawberry meal feeling - sometimes ohelakcyeseme)
starry sky; star field; galaxy; blanket of stars; night sky
soul; body and spirit (more formally 'eunyle; lit. starry sky belonging to (something); from the idea that the origin of life came from the stars; composed of nue - spirit and amem - body)
dance (also in'ate; in'ame for free form dance)
hemlock tree; a general term for evergreen trees
ford; place to cross a river
pillar cactus (from water needle; grows in towering columns filled with water; small pink blossoms grow between spikes
rift flower (red/pink on yellow/green vines; also called wlvhiish (warning flower))

all living people; corresponds with humanity; humankind; mankind; man (shortened to ajeuk/ajiin/ajiinyle in which can refer more abstractly as either one or more who share the same universal morals/core traits/values of humanity; can also be kaunajae/kaunaj/kauneuk/kauniin)
gods; deities; divine beings; religion; centers of religious worship (very very general term; pl; but used singularly)
warg; dog/wolf ridden as a mount (cais vargr)
true smile from feelings of happiness
brilliant malady; slightly radioactive green gemstone
seeds that fly in wind; rain seeds
pizza (tomato pancake; often called just shaikiis)
idol; icon; totem (of a spirit - tyuk; though many are empty)
large rigid flat bread; can be eaten as a light snack but is often served with meats and vegetables or jam and nut spreads.
pet name for small child (lit. small sweet thing)

thing of unknown origin or purpose (lit describe what/thing)
thing-a-ma-jig/bob; what-cha-ma-call-it (from what huh describe thing)

name tree (ceremonial tree within the kith kilan region planted in honor of someone for their wellbeing for life or afterlife (or to their detriment as a curse))
porridge or oat meal (from warm tasty grain; often bemai or marul)

warming gem (hard gem ranging from orange to black in color; has the ability to absorb and slowly release heat and quite cool when lacking heat; very useful for caravaning and its colors are often used to rank ability with black being highest)
gun (from metal tube; also called tyaukut or kutyau)
life; lifetime; life lived; experiences; autumn years
drive; determination; willingness to sacrifice anything even up to your life in exchange for something
feeling of willingness to sacrifice yourself for your child (your time/wants/needs); wanting to give everything to raise your child
potter; also used as flirtatious title

summit; peak; top of a mountain; snow covered mountain
anger at the world; at everything
viscous water; gel like due to chemical reactions that occur near rifts; an extremely good conductor of imai
lemon; kumquat (cactus lemon; lit yellow spine)
rainbow (from brilliant steam; also: cosaunan (steam color); so'iis (sun ripple); sosyunan (sunlight color); and mekho (after storm))

juice; pulp; common name for fruit of hardy kiwi vine which makes for a common form of juice

doldrum; windless section of the ocean
balance (slightly implies precarious); sword or knife-edge; scale (from the point that the fulcrum of the scale sits)
bruise; contusion (shortened to daok especially by kids to mean owie)
palms (hands hole, often shortened to nkhu)
palm  (also hedenkhud or henkh for short)
beast of burden; farm animal; pack animal (often ox or cow or reindeer)
stanza; verse (lit. joyful thought; sometimes just called enbau)
resurrection; revival (physical; in the sense of Christ it is esagomel since it's a self revival)
peak of a wave (from wave peak)

perfect wind (for sailing; often also kite flying)
pastry of a braided ring of noodles filled with seasoned meat and washed with egg before baking to a golden brown (from rope noodle)
lighter; match; something that gives off or starts a light
road; highway; trade route (maintained; lit. lit path)
decorative bamboo; highly prized for it's emerald color that seems to glow; grows only in extreme pure water (from yriae and possibly fosh; faethii; fueun; and/or fuii)

August (snow melt month; cor. w/ february)
next world; world to come; afterlife; heaven (lit future world)

skill or ability to control of imai
knuckle; approximate inch (from kuai and modified he-)
forearm; also foot (measure not body part); cubit (12-18 inches; from nakh + modified he-; also tskai)
power (implies more political or social; sometimes hashra')
an intense feeling of the spirit; a deep sense of being loved or lifted up that pierces one's soul. (sometimes tyehawa'wbe for extra emphasis on the feeling)
one of your friend group; usually a best friend
chrysalis (from leaf change); metamorphosis (esp leaves changing color)
article; piece of writing; essay (also zyremet)
morsel; little piece of food (from piece of bite)

wing (vhan for the pair of wings)

part; piece; portion; whit (more often seen as he- or zi-)
fight; sport; game (playful and typically active); pretend play

vanilla (often used in teas and incense)
plural person; system (as in DID system)

art of realism in various mediums
life (especially related to blood and biological life)
blood pot (mythical flower said to be found around migrating oases that grants eternal life)

the quiet sound (or lack there of) of snow falling
hermit crab (from shell crab; also ohwus from hidden crab)
place that makes one happy (from joy place)
house cat (lit little hunter; also hetae'a)

trough of a wave (from wave bottom)
snow/ice spirit (in the form of a cat)
the feeling of being alone among friends

imai carver (person who makes imai circuits)
very famous style of vhuteyan dance
other half; romantic partner; lover (from another + half of a pair; aka lonaka)
glass shield lizard (colonial transparent lizard with most organs within tail; loss of tail is detrimental)
silver (a preservative and counter to ghosts)
friend group; crew; possie; homies; bros; gang (should i keep going?)
hearty soup or stew served in a hollowed out loaf of bread or bread bowl (from soup canoe; often maiben)
cereal; typically with milk or yogurt (from grail soup; often mairul)
stew (from thick soup; often just maitzom)
chilled soup eaten as or with supper in the hot summer months cool soup
extreme cuteness or adorableness; cute aggression
medicine made from poison or venom
kettle; tea or coffee pot (backformed from jieyun)
large jar; deep pot; caldron (usually for boiling or fermenting; from thunder pot)
öland goose (a breed of goose; from swan duck (aka anything but safe duck duck); longer form is jojolaepyvon)
swan (from anything but safe duck; discord shenanigans)
fluffy goose (Sebastopol goose,;from safe duck - shortened form of the word for goose )
lily (lit leaf three pairs); often shortened to jukly
cocoon (from leaf wrap; can be read as silk or sand dune wrap as well)
otter (also kainuwa; kaiciinwa; kainwa; or nuwaciin)
owl fox; bipedal - head and legs of a fox and torso and wings of an owl
grave; often marked by rock cairns (from rest stone)
tongue root; back of the throat (velar)
oasis (from wandering pond; often migratory ones)
oasis spark (carnivorous flower found around oases with medicinal properties)
potato croquet; named for it's oblong shape (lit potato eɡɡ; also khalibn)
thunderstorm (building storm; farther off; no visible to faint lightning; rolling thunder; little to no rain)
lightning storm (lots of flashes; loud claps of thunder; often wind and rain; right above; very dangerous)
adrenaline from a child being in danger
idiom; proverb; saying; aphorism; apothegm; maxim
baking pan (any metal container used for baking)
expectations (from know water; also kui from the mood)
person who encodes (during the Hatsavhe was very important—if caught the coup might fail; modern times the term applies to respected persons often related to runes)
encoding; cypher; a thing hidden in plain sight only understood by those who know
jellyfish rock (often found near water; known for it's striking ripple pattern and luminescent glow when placed underwater; can make a small lantern using water drips)
game trap (nonlethal; usually a pitfall; cage; or rope)
an imaika that practices immorally; otherwise one whose practices are not accepted by society; witch
split; crack; crevice; casm (especially via earthquake)
an attack; assault; especially at night
order; sequence; list (from chain + ordinal suffix)
a reflection in water (thin rain water)
thin layer; powder; fine dust (often used with gold dust or imai)
truth; reliable concept (also kuojo; which is more like absolute or objective truth)
calabash squash (from tube zucchini; also called kutpaj or pajkut)
pump up music; work out song (lit adrenaline music)
music that makes you a bit melancholic (often in minor key)
morals; mortality (stems from right character; reanalyzed an adjective of song such as melodious)
creative block; artist's or writer's block
type of dragon deer with fur similar to a qirin
the feeling of "what the heck am I seeing/reading"
singing bowl (from sing; bowl; and sound)
sign; indicator; mark; token; symbol; glyph
a migration or fight for resources
cryofrozen thunderstorm (phenomenon that mainly occurs in the Rhew where electricity; low temperature; and abundance of imai cause a thunderstorm to be frozen in time)
cinnamon roll; something too pure for this world; something you inherently want to protect
The feeling of it raining and you’re inside all cozy (lit relaxed rain)
planet; sphere; strange world; the unknown
lizard (lit. sunbathing shield (shield often refers to scales)); can be shortened to li'en (also means statively exist; to lizard in other words lol)
screen (esp used in shadow puppet shows; lit wall stage)
state of sin or lack of progress (also yuncae)
salvation; redemption (also likaeme for a more physical sense)
night hours; hours of the starry sky (10pm to 6pm)
morning hours; hours of the bird cry (6am to 2pm)
afternoon hours; hours of the fox (2pm to 10pm)
berry (also more often as -ye when combining)
parch gill mushroom (concentric ringed cap of various shades of light blue; edible garlic tasting cap; produces a gel from the gills that causes dehydration symptoms when consumed)
koiwrit; calligraphy (writing skilled); also called Luvhten; Luvhyeo; or Luvvhu
comet (lit. star dragon; also called tkalyun)
orchid tuber powder (sweat and creamy; often used in desserts)
blast of air; wind burst; gust; fluky wind
flour (often rice; but also often wheat)
fulfillment that comes from patience and self-control (from heart or delicious self-control)
age; distinct period of history; (lit. past age)
pyrosomes (related to salps; tubular deep sea colonial creatures made up of luminescent zooids reminiscent of fire)
A long, narrow and thin cut off meat spread with an herb mixture on one side and rolled into a swirl before being cooked. Often called pinwheels in English speaking meat markets. (Lit: Spiral Meat)
winding mountain range; boulders set up in a swirling pattern for aesthetic and/or warding purposes; a giant stone statue/sentinel used for guarding straits
firewood (from energy/fire; lumber; and burn); fuel
the emotional energy that comes from listening to the sound of boiling water
library (often associated with temples/churches; and used as places to care for needy in community)
wolf bark (similar to cinnamon and suits savory dishes)
pass; strait; divide (usually easily traversed sailing or caravanning)
cloud cap mushroom (fluffy and white; large mushrooms that while not edible can increase plant growth through spores that act as fertilizer)
parent (often just han; mi can be analyzed as promise or meliorative marker)
spouse; marriage partner (from promise and lover)
atonement (has senses of being made whole or a cure as well as perfection or sacrificing through taking the place of)
tragic hero (usually one who sacrifices themselves for others)
feeling of willingness to sacrifice your life for your child
diced fruits mixed with an airy cream (whipped cream). Served cold and sometimes with small amounts of angel food cake
good mood; happy and relaxed state; chill; gladness; good cheer
perfect (complete) home (not necessarily perfect as in ideal; just what you need)
a clean and well kept home

tiger turtle (or death tiger; take your pick lol); often called nwajiae "tiger otters" when young since they have many characteristics of otters as kittens; as they grow older they take more turtle characteristics and resemble floating islands)
hunting instinct (from hunt or death within)
the delicate feeling of another person's touch (from good touch another person intimate feeling or mi-chome-iovi-kaun-kimang-ohe)
mother (used with demonstrative pronoun ie. my mom)
salps (deep sea colonial creatures made of semi-luminescent barrel shaped zooids)
frozen fruit treat often eaten during hot summer days; held by a stick frozen from the center and out
glass egg (pale white or yellow; novelty gemstone sold in shops; believed to bring good harvest)
steak mushroom; red and white marbled; very good substitute for beef
resting place; settling place; place of meditation of calming; safe and peaceful place often with the feeling of home; ideal place to live
journey; usually for the purpose of soul searching or self discovery; pilgrimage
hot pot; fondue pot (both the pot and the food)
flour made from tubers or beans
psyche; soul; spirit; mind; personality (thing that makes you you)
study of logic (also ennyojkveu and ennkveu)
firstling; first fruit (lit beginning fruit); initial crop or produce or result of something (often celebrated)
beginning; start of (often a name; also shortened to o'e)
immortality (also fusyna; synajo; caisyna; or eusna/eusyna)
soul butterfly (from myth that souls migrate to the after life on a butterfly; yearly butterfly migration is celebrated as a day of the dead)
earth deity (connected to a myth of the sun in a pot; forms the basis of practice of spirit jars - uses -je title)
croissant (from okjo - horn and tovh - bread)
cooking measurement (based on half cup; also called (on)penga'e (coconut water))
cooking measurement (based on seasoning to taste; a dash/pinch of something)
handfull (lit cup hand) more often shortened to ond to differ from the much smaller cooking amount
own; concept of possession (as in your own; acts a bit like a pronoun; bit archaic; often use the -el ending on pronouns instead)
ingredient (from paya + ja; also called sem'i)
dutch baby; German pancakes; yorkshire pudding (fluffy egg batter)
coconut (lit water.bottle fruit); also used for weight (approximately 5 pounds)
green or young coconut (from light.green coconut/water.bottle) also used for weight (approx 2.5 lbs or 1 kg)
bigger picture; life plan; destiny; purpose of life

breath stone (also called phu'ae; dense, partially translucent turquoise gem that forms in underwater conditions; comprised of two layers where the inner layer reacts in water to release breathable air)
popcorn (also phurul - more for any popped grain)
catfish (from trout cat or breath cat)
round popcorn; much lighter due to the puffed nature of its formation (often phuuba)
monster (dehumanized form of teno (household deity) malicious ghost or one that's lost their sanity)

quintet lark (from hit and play instrument; brighter colored lark (reds; oranges; and sometimes blues) very musical in voice and use of tools; mimics the sound of instruments and will often form small ensembles;  also a style of music in Vhuteya)
frog (rattle ears; shortened to qe'iip (also the onomatopoeia))
cure; tonic; medicine; method of healing (from make whole)
bone-faced warg (canis osvultus; from bone amyt (dog mount) or group of bones)
rice (of a variety that can grow in saltwater)
carrying; load; burden; cargo (plural but use singular - also known as vei'i)
inside corner (jutting away; space you can occupy)
footprints; the path you make through something (you're the trailmaker); steps
the feeling of falling asleep and then jolting back awake
parlor; living room; dining room (room where most social interactions happen in the house)
vacation; holiday; time off (from peaceful group)
bath; usually in a hot spring; but can include showers or other types of bathing
bath house; onsen (the hot spring itself is called kephunoa) includes massages; meditiation and rhnvham
art or meditating; relaxing; and finding inner peace
place of healing; holy place (also tyemui)
series of stretches similar to mix of tai chi and yoga
essence; central part; building block; base
waffle (from grid bread; sometimes just qwlo)
Rihs's Mimic (black bird of prey that enters other bird burrows and mimics/lures the birds using calls and its lighter colored stomach plumage)
surface; plane (has some basis of ri as essence)
pebble; nugget; small roundish thing (used for counting; and in pet names for kids a lot)
event; instance; occurence; moment; time (usually viewed as a whole rather than just the initial part of something (lyus))
grandpa (used when addressing; often shortened to savha)
clothes; outfit; clothing; apparel; raiment (more formally syyte)
bandage; plaster; gauze; band-aid (also bearhn and saesyy)
sandy (also hensae; from two different types of sand)
flax; long grass with edible seeds and fibers suitable for yarn production
thin flat bread (tortilla); often used to wrap meats; cheese; and vegetables; or fruit and nut spreads into convenient travel form factors
homesickness; melancholy; nostalgia; an unknown sadness
poles (north and south; important farthest point)
ink veil (mushroom - edible but toxic when consumed with alcohol)
sheath (from cover blade; can read as evening ridge)
first moon (bigger one; lit important white)
brilliant or brightly burning throne; majesty; godly glory
king; emperor; person of authority or center of power
wick; material used to soak up something esp oil as lantern fuel

terror wick; gemstone often mistaken for a hrenkan due to its slight darker color of red and in shimmer; believed to be associated with murder sites and soaking up remnant terror thereby bringing bad luck to wearers; although said to aid in anyone pursuing revenge of the murderer
master; decision maker; overseer; boss; judge; -sho = title
silliness; dorkiness; the loveable quality found in children that makes them cute
lamentation; wailing; weeping (often seen as sikmegi or sikmevo)
the desire for hot chocolate on a cold day
cold day's hot chocolate; the experience of a hot chocolate on a cold day
the need for hot chocolate on a cold day
wandering pig (dinohyus; giant wild pig (rain pig))
shrimp (also called sykat; from personified wrinkle)
ram (big male sheep-like animal; with massive curling horns)
eternity; forever; space; endless expance (also synjo)
eternal life; everlasting life (lit. eternal beginning of life and life lived)
place of forever; endless expanse; afterlife
light (usually natural light like the sun)
ritual covering or wrapping (sometimes religious clothing)
chunk; hunk; sizeable piece of something
gift giving; any holiday that involves exchanging of gifts
behemoth of a sailing ship; massive
aurora borealis; northern lights (from world soul light; sometimes metathesized to tyasunue)
shackles; handcuff; fetters; bindings for criminals or prisoners; bonds
grounded shipwreck found in the middle of the desert; ghost ship (from unlucky ship; believed to sail the desert at night)
approach; attitude; way of dealing with; manner; tactic
the way of things unknown (also ty'isiba)
violence (especially stemming from anger and hate; sometimes tekrichibo or shortened to tekrib)
curse (lit. threat rune; from a tampered rune on a rune lantern when traveling; the lantern then wouldn't be able to properly keep monsters away)
a household deity; minor god; spirit of the land (ie powerful being that'll make contracts; ghost that still has sanity); title = -ten(o)
skilled; talented person; master artist (worked to get there); also called shengka or yejo; -tejo = title
tip of the tongue; blade of tongue
temple (also called monhavo from home of god)
homeland; country of origin; birth place; place of heritage
native tribe; original people of an area (from homeland tribe)
defector (but more so going against a despotic government to help those targeted)
defector; traitor; coward; switch coat (very insulting)
a call or summon (often in context of an urge to do something)
axolotl (from ear gill; also qoxokyae or feather gill)
mouse parasol mushroom (edible brown with a slight fuzz on it's cap; squeaks when touched)
copper snake (venomous ambush predators that bury themselves in the sand; coppery scales that are often used in pottery glazes similar to raku style; often found near settlements)
abyss crystal (black crystal that forms in pitch black areas; has a light dimming attribute)
anguish; a pain that pierces one's soul (depth pain)
dragon rider (most often used for Yats)
term for a mail runner or a Yat (person of the Hekatl tribe of dragon riders)
iguana; crocodile; komodo dragon; or any type of scaly lizard
mirage lizard; chameleon (sensitive to rifts; often live near aijrun)
needle; thorn; spike; spine (often compounds as -niik)
joke (from make laugh; back-analyzed as boy focus or make chicken/clucking)
music (lit pleasing sound; more often use kuy tho)
bread bowl for soup or stew (lit bread canoe)
bad end; doom; destruction; downfall; terrible fate; ruin
victim (from own doom; also called tsan'uk (with terrible fate))
a type of sport native to the tsavhe
speaker or culture of tsevhu (from Hatsavheiin - people of the new season)
very tasty and satisfying food (lit. strawberry meal - sometimes akcyesema or akcyema)
grave shards; vivianite (forms on shells and fossils or corpses in iron coffins; soft and pliable; color darkens in sunlight)
end; finish; death (euphemism; often also associated with blood and old events)
grave marker; tombstone; rock cairn marking a grave
old or rotting blood; bloody smell; common insult (from grave blood)
déjà vu/deja vu; feeling of doing something or being somewhere before (from memory swirl or tseuman: trying to remember)
mathematics (sometimes shortened to tsikveu (deer notes lol))
forearm; also foot (measurement); cubit (12-18in; also hanakh)
trunk; branch (often also refers to tree or wood as well)

dryad lizard (speckled brown lizard with leafy frills on the end of its tail, has a seldom used dormant stage at birth that resembles a vine like growth around a tree trunk; this stage is sometimes called tsolomeno; eggs resemble green acorns without caps)
antlers (pair; from bone branch; hetsolom for singular)
sandworm (giant; vermis harenae (interestingly might have some connection to hrenae; possibly from all around sand))
cloud surfer (lit. air current sail; similar to wind surfer)
valley (carved sky; from a myth about the creation of valleys; often shortened to twmg)
perfected or mastered skill or ability
amazing/astouding thing; wonder (lit salt water sky; originating from when a thin layer of water covers a salt flat to make a natural mirror)
apple of your eye (lit. heaven's child; how parents will brag about their child)
apples of your eye (lit. heaven's children; how parents will brag about their children)
kilometer; mile (in between but closer to a kilometer ye)
chaos (often tye; can use as an intensifier for emphasis tye-)
consequence; result of someone's actions; deeds; or works
incense; joss stick (used for tracking time)
a spiritual deity; (lacks physical representation; represents an ideal; often a totem/soulful items)
mud; good earth; planting earth; any viscous liquid
direction the wind blows; angle of the wind
the perfect angle for sailing (beam reach) where you can get the fastest speed
outside corner (jutting toward; space you can't occupy); corner of object
underground; into ground (can be used with oblique det as a post phrase without a post)
farewell; goodbye; salutation (from pray safety; more the name of the action; the actual salutation is based on sail safe)
moon fan (from translucent half moon; glass like flower with three petals in the shape of a fan; grows in high mountains and has properties similar to caffeine)
second moon (smaller one; lit little orange)
new information; news; tidings (often just madj)
moon (not specific; Tsevhu has names for Onope's moons)
the pair of moons (lit. moon dance)
mooncaw (black bird of prey that hunts exclusively at night)
moon dust (silver dust made from crushed seeds, has a mint cooling effect)
the sweet spot for sailing where you have the perfect wind and you're sailing at the perfect angle
plain; steppe; prairie (usually higher elevation; not near bodies of water)
orchid (lit moth flower; often just lyhai)
genius; talented person (moreso born talented); also called shengka
fish with a jellyfish sack (another of adachi's thingies)
rune lantern (powered by imai; often made of stone; used to light trade roads and create safe places for travelers
drive to accomplish something (but at the expense of others usually)
needless self-sacrificial tendencies; not valuing your own life when there are clear other options
tetanus (lit. rust disease; also called apukiin and both can be an insult to a tribe (kiin also means tribe; eg invader tribe))
wendigo (also called vejaqom; nyngom; and qomyng)
loss (of something/an item; often times a person or used as an emotion)
stan; a bit of an over-obsessesd fan (kinda scary)
bad mood; angry/violent mood; fit of temper; temper tantrum
popular tart fruit drink (often carbonated like soda)
trail of a snake through the sand (lit. snake dance)
epic poetry (usually very long and verbal)
manul/palla's cat or a leopard lemur (ice cat)
dandelion from cat tooth or leafy cat; often xujuk)
doctrine; body of knowledge; core concepts or principles (sometimes yaekimri which more often acts as plural; lit. pillar knowledge essence)
pasta; more often of the noodle variety
glory; power; honor (from godly bright or simple bright)
creator god (origin of souls; both singular and dual)
sand (specifically the type used for glass)
peace; harmony; tranquility; serenity; quietness (also hronjo)
children (more specifically children of one family; else it's yojyu)
The feeling of ease when you finally managed to get the kids to bed (from kids lay down good feeling)
bamboo (hardy and desert tolerant; from faithful water; stemming from that these bamboo only grow in drinkable water)
hunting dog (smaller than amyt; also yrikiim or kiimyri)
reindeer (often used as a term for various pack animals)
ship stranded in doldrums (lit dry sail)
torii gate; esp a gate in holy places as a boundary between worlds
heir (masc); inheritor; crown Prince; young master - title
heir (fem); inheritor; crown princess; young madam- title
wolf ears flower (similar to tulip; bluish gray petals; longer and droopier variety called zangiip)
okay; alright; fine (semi-affirmative; not so happy)
ah; ah yes; huh; wow; (filler word that expresses a bit of disbelief or agreement)
hey (addressing someone next to you); also often aej or 'ei or 'ae
no (disagreement) [winner of the GRAND TSEVHU YES/NO TOURNAMENT! (tm)]
exactly right; yes 100%; irrevocably; without a doubt; even so; verily
lo; look at that; woah; draw attention; look look (often with pointing)
yes; yea; yeah; aye; so (another form of the affirmative; has the meliorative affix)
hey; hey you; hey *name* (yell trying to catch attention from a distance)
then again (lit. on top of then)
yes (neutral agreement; affirmative) [winner of the GRAND TSEVHU YES/NO TOURNAMENT! (tm)]
however; but; wait; hold on (sort of a thing to say when you need to say something; to interrupt the convo; also tanogi)
what? huh? (express confusion; always question; often uy or ya)
awesome; cool; wow; the sound of awe
besides; apart from; other than; different from
anyway; in spite of; despite; nevertheless; even so
like; as (comparison); such as (for nouns); existing as; to be; same as (nominal)

as; so that; up to the point; insofar; inasmuch; to the extent of or degree that (used sometimes in comparisons; also can be used as a clause marker for verbs like show or say especially in passive formations (roots biin and et/en) as a way of forming full clauses like quotes) from sagri and thyn)
in doing so; by doing so; causing; resulting; that; by so; that; so that (has some overlap with tegu and sagyn)
for; so that; since; therefore; because (of); as a result of (check with -'ia suffix; shoku gets used more with clauses and -'ia gets used with phrases; might also overlap a bit with hmaeci)
unless; without; when lacking (check that it's not -cae/-n or negative commitative/attributive)
from (...) to (...) (any kind of range) uses dual form in a post phrase if the same word; otherwise; treated like conj
reason being; for this reason; in order to; to this end; that thereby; by means of; as a result of (similar to -'ia and shoku; fairly synonymous with meku; from because to the extent of)
behold; for behold; so pay attention (from pay attention and so; sometimes shortened to simeku or simek also akyset)

also; too; and; and then (used outside of clauses as more a transition/introduction to a new line of thought; or as a response to what someone is saying (like go on); from today also); when used as "tanogi" it means wait; hold on; let me talk
namely; or; that is; such as; in other words (from enraxa - "continue saying"; used when introducing lists or clarifying/rewording; often where English uses colon)

in a/the way that (used often when describing how a whole action affects something: basically tega- compounds with clause marker to make the whole clause takes a case; tega- agrees with active -d or stative -o)
though; although; even though (from but and even so)
until; till; up till (clausa; used sometimes in conditional clauses)
neither/nor (nominal); used as a conj between two (ie neither you nor me) -- if used to refer to a whole group (ie neither of us) use cyhe- (ie cyhebe) = not piece of us
whereby; by what way; in what way; by which means; through which (a bit synonymous with how)
or; either/or; (either one or the other; but not both) (verbal; adv; adj)
or; either/or; (either one or the other; but not both) (clausal)
since then; from then till now; ever since

and (verbal; adv; adj) (optional (else -g- on added verbs); used often with CL1 verbs; esp active; when verbs are far away; or in compound verbs in partly passive constructions; optionally on when verbs use same major case)
and so; and then; therefore; consequently; ergo; hence (if the first event results in the second; use consequential. if they're unrelated/independent use this)
or; either/or; (either one or the other; but not both) (nominal)
and (nominal) (often optional or can be switched with commitative; check morpho sheet before using)
but; exception; save; yet; though; although; however (clausal)
and/or (one; the other; or both) (verbal; adv; adj)
wherefore; for what reason or cause; why (archaic: lit. for reason what; also shokuyen; more often just shoku or yshokun)
but; exception; except; save; and instead; yet (verbal); instead (of) (clausal specifically)
except for/that; but for; with exception of; excluding; not including; apart from
and again; once more; repeating this (lit and then and; used to emphasize; for repetition in verbs use aspect suffixes but can add on this to make very exaggerated)
and so; and now; thus; in this way/manner (can use as an adv with the adverb ending); by so
even as; just as; at the same time; while; even in; at that moment (clausal or oblique)
it is time; now's the time (full: itotama li itox)
similarly; likewise; in the same way; even so
truly; verily; confirmed; certainly; precisely; exactly (use kuon as the interjection form; used that way for Amen and I swear)
long ago; long since past; ago; past
at first; at the start or beginning (from at zero)
it's just that; perhaps; more to the point
definitely; fully; whole heartedly (also iimbenmik; benmikri; camynmik; camynri)
yet; still; by now; until now; so far
little by little; piece by piece (lit. pebble by pebble)
even; even to the point; encompassing; fully (to such a degree; to a degree that extends; emphasis; intensive; one of the few adv that doesn't agree)
forever; ever; on and on; always
both (applied to actions; doesn't always imply two but often does)
really; rather; much; pretty; a lot; a great deal; so very (intensifier)
in a way; to a certain extent (from according to one method)
when (question word; double check it's not conditional or when as a pronoun)
ironic/irony; flippant; tongue in cheek (lit. tongue of teeth; interdental)
farthest; farthest most point(s) of something (far-est)
small (usually affixed; o'a when subj comp)
absolutely wild; anything but tame; refusing to get domesticated
happy; merry; joyful; festive; celebratory mood
even; balanced; level; parallel to the ground
needed; required; necessary; requisite (based off mood hde)
concept of being fully alive; lively; quick in response and alert and awake; living in the moment; experiencing everything it means to be alive
new to someone rather than being brand new (more like TIL)
self; personal; of your own being (often -el)
wild; primal (esp in terms of environment)
lit; illuminated; lighted; incandescent (weirdly enough; not a participle but has a version that is so that tense can be applied)
straight out of paradise; paradisiacal; heavenly
fellow; one of something; sharing the same characteristic
tranquil; peaceful; placid; calm; still; serene; quiet (compare nus or nos)
all of; the full extent of
only; no more than; single; one remaining; just
just/only disappointed (implies that they're more than that though)
intimate; emotionally connected (from make known/build knowledge)
wild; feral (especially referring to very very large creatures)
more than one speaker (of a language)
favorite (also tecetne or teyone or teteri)
overwhelming relief especially after a difficult or stressful situation; sudden release of tension
moderate; even-tempered; sober; sensible; calm; quiet; mellow; self-regulating (compare cael/caelri)
quiet; soft sound; soft spoken; not loud
constant; continuous; enduring (compare with iqy paradigm and syn; for adverb form more often -raxa or hmairaxa)
pale; seethrough; clear; translucent (also used when describing white or albino things)
low spirited; dejected; sad; downcast; dispirited; depressed
homesick; melancholic; nostalgic; unknowingly sad (sometimes sayomona)
firm; solid; rigid; stiff; dense; hardened (esp used with metals)
sad; sorrowful; melancholic (lit. full of tears)
absent; missing; lacking (also tiancae and licae and solin)
endless; never-ending; forever; everlasting; eternal (also synlij and liraxaj)
infinite; ever expanding (also haero; can also use ho- as exponential)
head-ache tired/brain dead (so sleep deprived your head hurts)
native; naturally occuring at a certain location (from homeland source)
skilled; talented (worked to get there); often just yeo
deep (also ta esp as an affix)
imminent; at hand; coming; impending (timewise this is nui or linui)
anxious; worried; unsettled; troubled (constant state of unreasonable anxiety)
dizzy; nauseous; sea sick (from spiral around)
crazy; out of control (from chaos wild)

lit building pressure but along the lines of time bomb; thin ice; waiting for the other shoe to drop;
instable or causing instability; something bound to go wrong; hot potato; accident waiting to happen
utter chaos; completely out of control
tired; weary; exhausted; depressed (physically and emotionally)
wild; insane; rabid; frothing; absolutely crazy (from xa- and wild/feral)
extremely bitter; bad tasting; refusing to accept
anxious; worried (momentary anxiety caused by situation)
light of God/Christ; divine spark; inherent dignity or value
divide among; split up; apportion out
lots; stones thrown as a method of making a decision; analogous to a coin toss or nose goes (also shokano)
doing or acting with good conduct
well-doing; good conduct or action (also participle form such as rujenokh or rujenoj)
lay (as in lay bricks or a foundation)
lay the groundwork for; prepare (especially plans for the future)
proceed; start to do or act or move forward; originate from; come (also efebi and chuobi)
possess; own (more permanently; often also owavha)
ascend (especially of the type that physically challenges or changes)
ascend to (such as in cultivator novels where one ascends into immortality; similar to carp leaping the dragon gate)
ascend; out of body experience (in some cases a near death experience)
midst; in the midst; in the middle of (more often motseu as the post version)
advocate; plead on behalf of (especially in a court of law)
name; define; call (also wbase or viise)
named; called (also viibamcet or wbamcet can be used in introductions; alt can use wbalse or viibalsme or viilmse if it's markedly voluntary on both parties)
sibling in name; like kin (brethren and sisters in culture; beliefs; morals; values etc.)
feel like doing; feel to do; in the mood to do (can do ohe- + verb)
call on; turn to; appeal to; beg; beseech; plead; petition
multitude of; extremely large amount of; uncountable
tender; gentle; thoughtful; empathetic (especially towards someone you care about on a deep level)
mark; print; scar; something that marrs the surface of
house frame (vhenu; vhenuvi; vhentenu; or vhentenuvi for building frame or more generic frames)
framer usually of houses (building framer can be vhenuka)
mind; intent; thought process; purpose; like-mindedness
